channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KS

item.title: Report X-2023120482
item.description:
Report X-2023120482

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-06
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023120482 SequenceEvent: WHILE THE PACKAGE HANDLER WAS UNLOADING THE TRAILER, THEY NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS LEAKING AND MOVED IT TO THE END OF THE TRAILER AND NOTIFIED THEIR MANAGER. THE MANAGER QUICKLY INFORMED QA OF THE SITUATION AND QA GRABBED A TOTE LINED WITH A CLEAR HAZMAT BAG, FOLD ABSORB AND NEUTRALIZER. THEY RUSHED OVER TO THE AREA AND PLACED THE PACKAGE IN THE TOTE. QA CLEANED UP THE AREA WITH THE FOLD ABSORB. ONCE IT WAS SAFE, THEY BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO QA AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS LOADED ON ITS SIDE AND CAUSED ONE OF THE CONTAINERS TO LEAK OUT THRU THE CAP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND CLEANED UP WITH FOLD ABSORB. 2. X-2023120485 SequenceEvent: WHILE QA WAS CLEANING UP A SPILL, THEY NOTICED THIS WAS ALSO IN THE SAME TRAILER AND WAS WET. THEY PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE AREA WITH FOLD ABSORB. ONCE IT WAS SAFE, THEY BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE QA AREA AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS LOADED ON ITS SIDE AND CAUSED THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT THRU ONE OF THE CAPS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND CLEANED UP WITH FOLD ABSORB. 3. X-2023120488 SequenceEvent: WHILE THE PACKAGE HANDLER WAS PICKING OFF THE IC BELT, THEY NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS WET AND POSSIBLY LEAKING. THEY PLACED IT THE FLOOR AND INFORMED THE MANAGER. THE MANAGER QUICKLY INFORMED QA THE SITUATION THEY HAD. QA QUICKLY GRABBED A TOTE LINED WITH A CLEAR, LARGE HAZMAT BAG AND FOLD ABSORB. THEY RUSHED OVER TO THE AREA. THEY NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS AN OXIDIZER AND PLACED IN THE TOTE. QA MADE SURE THE AREA WAS SAFE AND SECURE. THEY BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO QA AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS LOADED ON ITS SIDE AND CAUSED ONE OF THE CONTAINERS TO LEAK OUT THRU THE CAP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE AND CLEANED UP WITH FOLD ABSORB.

Report X-2023120453

  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: MANAGER NOTIFIED QA OF THE LEAKING PACKAGE. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: ALL FOUR OF THE BOTTLES WERE LEAKING OUT FROM AROUND THE CAPS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report E-2023120122
item.description:
Report E-2023120122

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a spill that occurred inside of a trailer and one their dock in Kansas City, KC. The spill consisted of approximately 5 ounces of Unisol Liquid Red BK-50, which released from one of the small tubes at the bottom of (1) empty 330 gallon metal tote. The terminal stated the tote only had residue inside of the tote. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal, who stated they wiped up the spill with absorbents and placed the spilled contents into a 5 gallon poly drum that was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023120081
item.description:
Report X-2023120081

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-22
  • City: OLATHE
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Trailer was being unloaded and the package was discovered underneath several tires. The box and the bag inside the box had a tear in it causing it to leak contents. DescribePack: There is a tear at the bottom of the plastic bag DurationRel: 9 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a tote and removed from the other packages. Any wet package was removed from the trailer.

item.title: Report X-2023120052
item.description:
Report X-2023120052

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-21
  • City: OLATHE
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered underneath another package that had been placed next to trailer to be loaded before the trailer was closed. Package was leaking and had leaked onto another Hazmat package that was underneath it. DescribePack: One of the bottles is dented and cracked causing leaking. Another bottle is dented but is not leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the package was placed in a tote and removed from other packages.

item.title: Report X-2023111342
item.description:
Report X-2023111342

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-13T18:12:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-24
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UNLOAD SUPERVISOR CALLED IN A LEAKING HAZMAT TO THE DMP. RESPONDER WAS DISPATCHED TO THE SPILL WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART. RESPONDER ARRIVED AND CONSULTED THE DECISION TREE ON HOW TO RESPOND. RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL ACCORDING TO THE GUIDLINES. RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK THE LEAKER TO THE DMP.

item.title: Report X-2023111239
item.description:
Report X-2023111239

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-13T18:12:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-20
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A package handler dropped the package on it's side causing a cap to come off and create a hazardous spill. QA was notified and the spill was contained. DescribePack: One cap had come off as a result of the drop. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a plastic lined tote and neutralizer was used to render the hazmat safe for cleanup.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was discovered by a manager when opening a trailer in the unloads, It was promptly reported to QA. DescribePack: The liquid leaked through a loose cap and soiled the other contents. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: The leaker was placed in a tote with a liner and the spill was cleaned with absorb-all

DescribePack: One bottle leaked out of the cap, staining the other bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a plastic lined tot and brought to QA for processing.

item.title: Report X-2023110754
item.description:
Report X-2023110754

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-02
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE THE PACKAGE HANDLER WAS UNLOADING THE TRAILER, THEY NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS LEAKING AND INFORMED THEIR MANAGER. THE MANAGER, QUICKLY INFORMED QA OF THE SITUATION. QA RUSHED OVER TO THE AREA WITH A TOTE LINED WITH A CLEAR, LARGE HAZMAT BAG AND FOLD ABSORB. ONCE THE AREA WAS CLEANED, THEY BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO QA AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE BOTTLE IS CRUSHED IN AT THE SIDE FROM BEING DROPPED AND LOADED ON ITS SIDE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE AND CLEANED UP WITH FOLD ABSORB.
